intro: Leptocladia echinaria, commonly known as the spiny green alga, is a species of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its filamentous structure, with thallus composed of branched, ribbon-like cells. The plant typically grows in marine environments, particularly in rocky substrates along coastal regions. Its cells are often covered with small, spiny projections, giving it a distinctive appearance. Leptocladia echinaria is widely distributed in temperate and tropical waters around the world.
